title: Former NFL Player Talks Bipolar Disorder In Greensboro
text:

Keith O'Neil played for the Cowboys and Giants and won a super bowl with the Indianapolis Colts in 2007.  //on.wfmy.com/1LkKw22   Join the Conversation To   Former NFL Player Talks Bipolar Disorder In Greensboro WFMY News 2 Staff 6:25 p.m. EDT October 8, 2015 INDIANAPOLIS - 2007: Keith O'Neil of the Indianapolis Colts poses for his 2007 NFL headshot at photo day in Indianapolis, Indiana. (Photo by Getty Images) (Photo: Getty Images, Getty Images) 1 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Former NFL Player Discusses Battle With Bipolar Disorder Former NFL Player Talks About Living With Bipolar 
GREENSBORO, N.C. -- A former NFL player is taking center stage in Greensboro Thursday. Keith O'Neil played for the Cowboys and Giants and won a super bowl with the Indianapolis Colts in 2007. 
However, Thursday his message won't be sports. He's sharing his personal story about living with bipolar disorder and how mental health can impact anyone. 
"My time in the league was very bitter sweet," O'Neil said. "As I was enjoying being a professional athlete, I was battling a lot of demons, in my head, it was very hard, a lot of sleepless nights, a lot of emotional times for me and my family." 
Doors open at 6:15 p.m. Thursday. The event starts at 7p.m. in the Aycock Auditorium at UNC Greensboro. It's free to the public and a great way to learn about mental health. WFMY News 2's sports anchor Liz Crawford is moderating the event. Read or Share this story: http://on.wfmy.com/1LkKw22 TOP VIDEOS
